content:
• Wednesday, August 7, 2013
  • VALE

    Vale profit plunges on weaker currency, but says could ultimately benefit

    • Vale's (NYSE:VALE)Â Q2 profit plunged 84%, due in part to foreign exchange losses; Vale’s earnings have now dropped every quarter for the past two years.
    • Says its investment budget could ultimately benefit from a weaker Brazilian real, citing expansion of the Carajas iron ore mine in the Amazon; estimated capex through 2018 is $19.67B, but only $2.86B has been executed so far - "Such savings are not yet reflected in the expected capex for the approved projects under construction."
    • Produced 73.2M metric tons of iron ore and pellets vs. 80.5M a year earlier.
    • Shares -5.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • GMCR

    For Green Mountain, the devil may be in the details

    • Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) is off 6% AH following FQ3 results which beat on the bottom line. While a narrow revenue miss is likely behind some of the stock's weakness, there are other, more subtle factors at work.
    • GMCR has changed the language it uses in its long term guidance. From today's report (emphasis added): "Over the long term, the company expects double digit annual revenue growth." Last quarter, GMCR said this: "The company continues to be comfortable with its longer-term outlook of annual net sales growth of 15% to 20%. Is that a guide down?
    • Also note that Q4 revenue guidance (Y/Y growth of 11-15%) is measured against Q4 2012 net sales minus $90M to account for a (sort of) anomalous extra week on last year's calendar.
    • See Herb Greenberg's take for more.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 PM
  • DXCM

    More on Dexcom earnings

    • DexCom (NASDAQ:DXCM) moves up on a solid Q2 earnings beat.
    • Product revenue grew 65% Y/Y. Total revenue, which included development grant and other revenue, grew 53% over the same period.
    • Product gross profit totaled $21.8M, compared to $10.6M in Q212.
    • Shares +12.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM

  • Shares of Tesla active in the post-session on solid earnings beat

    • Shares of Tesla Motors remain active in the post-session, having traded over 4M shares since reporting a narrower Q2 loss.
    • The company beat across the board as gross margins and increased production topped most Wall Street analysts' expectations.
    • Shares are now +13.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 PM
  • KAR

    Kar Auction Services prices 15M share secondary offering

    • KAR Auction Services prices its 15M share secondary offering at $25 per share, nearly in-line with today's closing price.
    • The selling stockholder, KAR Holdings II, LLC, is the sole seller, KAR won't receive any proceeds from the offering.
    • Credit Suisse, Goldman, Sachs and JPMorgan are acting as joint book-running managers.
    • Shares +0.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM
  • ORIG

    More on Ocean Rig earnings

    • Ocean Rig UDW (NASDAQ:ORIG) Q2 beats across the board.
    • Revenues from drilling contracts decreased marginally by $3.7M to $259.8M, as compared to $263.5M for the same period in 2012.
    • Rig operating expenses decreased to $117M from $145M in the prior year period.
    • The company announces that board director Trygve Arnesen has resigned for personal reasons. In his place, it appoints Mr. Kyros Melas.
    • Mr. Melas serves as a Board member, Business Development Director and Founding Partner of EDT Oil & Gas, a Cyprus-based oil and gas services company specializing in the supply of high specification offshore support vessels to oil and gas industry worldwide. Shares +6.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM
  • VALE

    Vale EPS of $0.08

    • Vale (NYSE:VALE): Q2 EPS of $0.08 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.34.
    • Revenue of $11.3B misses by $0.02B.
    • Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • MRIN

    More on Marin Software: Revenue guidance strong, and so is spending growth

    • Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) +5.2% AH after beating consensus Q2 earnings and revenue estimates.
    • Non-GAAP gross profit was $11M (margin of 61%, up 2% Y/Y).
    • Adjusted EBITDA was -$7M, compared to -$4.8M in Q2 2012, as operating expenses ballooned 41.6%. (8-K)
    • Marin had 584 active advertisers (generating at least $2K in revenue during at least one month), up from 487 last year.
    • The company's Q3 revenue outlook of $19.6M-20M is a hair above consensus of $19.5M. Likewise, full-year revenue guidance of $76M-76.8M comes above a consensus of $75.61M.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • TCPTF

    Thompson Creek beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Thompson Creek Metals (NASDAQ:TC): Q2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $117.8M (+3.8% Y/Y) beats by $14M.
    • Says commissioning of all major equipment for the Mt. Milligan mill is underway and progressing on schedule; first ore feed is expected by mid-August.
    • Shares +8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSKN

    MELA Sciences EPS in-line, misses on revenues

    • MELA Sciences (MELA): Q2 EPS of -$0.17 in-line.
    • Revenue of $144.4K misses by $105.6K. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRYS

    More on Dry Ships earnings

    • Dry Ships (NASDAQ:DRYS) Q2 beats on all counts.
    • Drybulk carrier net voyage revenues were $42.4M, compared to $58.6M.
    • Tanker segment net voyage revenues were $9.1M, as compared to $8.5M.
    • Offshore drilling segment revenues from drilling contracts decreased by $3.7M to $259.8M, as compared to $263.5M for the same period in 2012.
    • Total vessels', drilling rigs' and drillships' operating expenses decreased to $142.5M from $ 167.3M.
    • Company continues to be defensive over the short-term prospects of the shipping markets. Asset prices seem to be holding up but it doesn't expect any positive development in drybulk and tanker charter rates this year.
    • As a result, the company is focusing on reducing breakeven levels. It's lowered newbuilding capital expenditures significantly as well as other areas.
    • Shares +1.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • PKT

    More on Procera: $20M order from "mega-carrier" disclosed on CC

    • During its Q2 CC, Procera (NYSEMKT:PKT) announces it has received a $20M order from aÂ "mega-carrier"Â that will ramp in Q3. Up-front hardware costs related to the deal will depress Q3 gross margin to the ~50% level, but margins are forecast to rebound in Q4 to the ~60% level when software licensing revenue from the deal begins to be recognized.
    • Also: Procera announces it has received $4M in new orders in the current quarter.
    • Q2 results, guidance
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • RVLT

    Revolution Lighting Technology fading gains after Q2 results

    • Revolution Lighting (RVLT +2.3%) faded in afternoon trading after being up as much as 12.8% earlier in the day in response to its Q2 report.
    • The company says it's pleased with the results, while adding it's seeing a "steady increase in LED adoption" and anticipates continued revenue and earnings growth acceleration on the back of a "robust" business pipeline.
    • A possible reason the market reconsidered its initial reaction: Revolution's 10Q indicates the vast majority of its $6.3M in Y/Y revenue growth came from the acquisitions of Seesmart and LIT, and that the company's Lumificient sales component declined 3.5% from $882K to $852K. (10Q)
    • Also of note: sales to a group of related entities represented 58% of revenues. Talk about customer risk.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • GNMK

    GenMark Diagnostics EPS in-line, beats on revenues

    • GenMark Diagnostics (NASDAQ:GNMK): Q2 EPS of -$0.25 in-line.
    • Revenue of $5.22M beats by $0.17M. Shares +5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • IMPV

    Imperva misses by $0.06, misses on revenues

    • Imperva (NASDAQ:IMPV): Q2 EPS of -$0.10 misses by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $31.3M (+28% Y/Y) misses by $0.08M. Shares -5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • HALO

    More on Halozyme Therapeutics earnings

    • Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO) posts a mixed Q2, missing on its EPS but beating on revenue.
    • Total sales rose by included 85% Y/Y, but included $8.7M in revenue from R&D reimbursements from partners primarily related to manufacturing activities to support their launches.
    • R&D expenses also rose due to the increase in manufacturing activities to support partner launches, as well as an increase in clinical trial activities.
    • SG&A costs rose on increased commercial activities.
    • Shares +1.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM

  • After-hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SMT +42%. GRPN +18%. TSLA +12%. IPAS +12%. CECO +11%.
      Top losers: FIO -20%. TUMI -18%. SGI -15%. OTC:ACFN -11%. SCTY -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • VEON

    VimpelCom surges on analyst upgrade, new CFO, Q2 results

    • Shares of VimpelCom (VIP +4.5%) finished up strongly after Deutsche's Igor Semenov upgraded the Russian mobile carrier to Buy from Hold with a PT of $11.80, while citing an attractive valuation.
    • Although Deutsche cut its PT by 6% in conjunction with the upgrade, it sees upside of 20% for shares. Semenov calls VimpelCom's 13-17% valuation discount relative to peers"excessive," even after accounting for VimpelCom's "weaker growth profile vs peers, as well as its M&A and governance risks."
    • Previous: Vimpelcom appoints new CFO, shares up following Q2 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • GPK

    Graphic Packaging Holding Co. announces public offering

    • Selling stockholders will offer 15M shares of Graphic Packaging Holding Company (NYSE:GPK) in a secondary offering. The number of outstanding shares will not be affected. (PR)
    • GPK -2.42% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • ORIG

    Ocean Rig UDW beats by $0.27, beats on revenues

    • Ocean Rig UDW (NASDAQ:ORIG): Q2 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.27.
    • Revenue of $259.84M beats by $8.04M. Shares +2.45% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • PKT

    Procera guidance healthy, shares +5.8% AH

    • Though Procera (NYSEMKT:PKT) is merely reiterating its guidance for 2013 revenue growth of "at least 30%," that's better than a 29.1% consensus.
    • 10 new carrier customers were added in Q2, two of which were mobile carriers. 21 customers (7 mobile) were added in Q1. Four expansion orders were booked from tier-1 carriers.
    • Recently-acquired Vineyard Networks posted 63% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • Thanks in part to the Vineyard acquisition, opex +80% Y/Y to $14.9M, outpacing rev. growth of 22%.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • SGI

    SGI issues light guidance, shares -14.6% AH

    • SGI expects FQ1 revenue of $160M-$170M and EPS of $0.07-$0.14, below a consensus of $181.5M and $0.18.
    • The company suggests the timing of product ramps and major high-performance computing hardware deals is responsible for the light guidance, and will leads its FY14 "financial performance to be weighted toward the second half of the fiscal year."
    • Shares still +66% YTD
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • ARRS

    Arris beats by $0.21, beats on revenues

    • Arris (NASDAQ:ARRS): Q2 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.21.
    • Revenue of $1B beats by $24.43M. Shares +4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • IMUC

    ImmunoCellular Therapeutics beats by $0.08

    • ImmunoCellular Therapeutics (OTCPK:IMUC): Q2 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.08. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • TSLA

    More on Solar City earnings

    • Solar City (SCTY) Q2 misses on the bottom line on higher than anticipated losses.
    • Residential megawatts deployed grew 144% Y/Y.
    • Estimated nominal contracted payments up to $1.4B.
    • Positive net cash flow of $19M.
    • Cumulative Energy Contracts signed and outstanding increased 105% over the prior year to 54,650.
    • Cumulative Customers grew to 64,411, up 97%.
    • Looking forward, the company increases its EPS loss estimates for Q3, now anticipating an EPS loss of between $0.50 - $0.60, higher than analysts expectations for a $0.38 per share loss.
    • Shares -7.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • MUR

    Murphy Oil names Roger Jenkins as President/CEO

    • Murphy Oil (NYSE:MUR) names Roger Jenkins as President and CEO, effective Aug. 30, succeeding Steven Cosse.
    • MUR also approves the spin-off of its Murphy USA retail marketing business, which will trade under the MUSA ticker.
    • Shares +2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • ARRY

    Array BioPharma down AH following earnings beat

    • Array BioPharma (NASDAQ:ARRY) slumps 2.3% AH despite beating on both lines with its FQ4 report.
    • The company says it has been notified that "Amgen has elected to end [the companies'] glucokinase activator partnership" — that deal "provided for up to $658M in milestone payments" to ARRY under certain circumstances. (8-K)
    • ARRY also says it will reduce its staff by 20%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • DRYS

    Dry Ships beats by $0.02, revenue beats

    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q2 EPS loss of $0.05 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $336M, beats by $7M. (PR)
    • Shares -1.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • OSUR

    OraSure beats by $0.05, beats on revenues

    • OraSure (NASDAQ:OSUR): Q2 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $24.33M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $0.66M. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • PPO

    Polypore International beats by $0.01, misses on revenues

    • Polypore International (NYSE:PPO): Q2 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $168.9M misses by $9.2M. Shares -8.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • MDLZ

    Mondelez International beats EPS estimates on broad growth

    • Mondelez International (NASDAQ:MDLZ): Q2 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $8.62B in-line. (PR)
    • FY13 EPS reaffirmed.
    • MDLZ +2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io guidance light, shares now -18.8% AH

    • Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) expects FQ1 revenue of $80M-$90M, well below a $123.8M consensus.
    • FY14 guidance is for 20% revenue growth, below a consensus for 30% growth. FY14 gross margin guidance is set at 52%-54%, below the company's FY13 GM of 60.1%.
    • No explanation is given for the shortfalls. Soft sales to Apple/Facebook have been blamed for light guidance in the past.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • LLNW

    Limelight Networks misses by $0.02, misses on revenues

    • Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW): Q2 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $42.76M misses by $3.17M. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • HK

    Halcon Resources announces 38M-share public offering, shares -8% AH

    • Halcon Resources (NYSE:HK) -8% AH after announcing a public offering of 38M shares of common stock.
    • HK plans to use proceeds to repay borrowings under its senior secured revolving credit facility, which has been drawn upon to partially fund acquisitions of both leasehold and producing properties in core areas.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 6 Comments
  • TSLA

    Solarcity misses by $0.05, revenue beats

    • SolarCity (SCTY): Q2 EPS loss of $0.43, misses by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $46.6M.
    • Shares -1.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • TSLA

    More on Tesla Motors

    • Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) says it sold 5,150 Model S vehicles in North America during Q2.
    • The automaker's jump in gross margin to 22% is a surprise and could keep analysts busy crunching new numbers.
    • The quarter ended with no government debt on the books. (PR)
    • TSLA +9.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 66 Comments
  • CTL

    CenturyLink revenue and EPS beat, EPS guidance light, shares lower

    • CenturyLink (NYSE:CTL): Q2 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $4.53B (-2% Y/Y) beats by $10M.
    • Free cash flow of $703M vs. net income of $417M.
    • Expects Q3 revenue of $4.5B-$4.55B and EPS of $0.59-$0.64 vs. consensus of $4.52B and $0.65.
    • Expects 2013 revenue of $18.05B-$18.2B and EPS of $2.63-$2.73 vs. consensus of $18.1B and $2.74. Slightly lowers 2013 free cash flow guidance to $3B-$3.15B from $3.05B-$3.25B.
    • Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters slumps after revenue and guidance disappoint

    • Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) points to a "drive in leverage" for its better-than-expected bottom line for FQ3.
    • Gross margin improved 720 bps to 42.1% as favorable green coffee costs as well as lower labor and manufacturing costs improved the company's bottom line.
    • For FY13, Green Mountain sees net sales growth of 13% to 14% and EPS of $3.19-$3.24 (PR).
    • GMCR -7.4% AH as traders aren't in a forgiving mood for the coffee concern's revenue miss.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • SNY

    Sanofi upped to Buy at Berenberg

    • Sanofi (SNY +1%) finishes the day higher after Berenberg ups the shares to Buy.
    • The firm sees a potential 17% upside for the stock after recent weakness. Earnings growth should be in the high single digits for the rest of 2013.
    • Full-year guidance also "looks comfortably achievable" because of growth drivers and reductions to 2013 forecasts.
    • Additionally, the Lantus franchise will remain a potent growth franchise over the medium term, while new products have been winning approvals.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io beats by $0.01, misses on revenues

    • Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO): FQ4 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $106.1M misses by $4.1M. Shares -9.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon EPS in-line, revenue beats, buyback announced, shares jump

    • Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN): Q2 EPS of $0.02 in-line.
    • Revenue of $608.7M (+7% Y/Y) beats by $2.5M. Gross billings of $1.41B.
    • $300M buyback announced.
    • Expects Q3 revenue of $585M-$635M and EPS of -$0.01 to $0.01 vs. consensus of $621.6M and $0.05. 2013 operating income guidance maintained.
    • Shares +11.9% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • CF

    CF Industries says it's open to cash deployment ideas

    • CFÂ Industries (CF +0.2%), facing pressure from the Third Point hedge fund to deliver a large dividend, says in its conference call that it’s open to examining how the company returns cash to shareholders.
    • Also from the call, CF says its quarterly EPS was the second highest on record, its nitrogen business set a new quarterly revenue record and gross margin for the segment was second only to last year's Q2 when average daily natural gas market prices were 44% lower than this year.
    • CF expects to see U.S. corn acres at 92M, below the USDA estimate of 97M, but shouldn't affect urea demand; nitrogen product inventories coming out of Q2 across all products are low.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • ALJ

    Alon USA expects California rail crude permits by year-end

    • Alon USAÂ Energy (ALJ -2.5%) expects to the receive necessary permits by year-end to build a rail offloading system at its Bakersfield, Calif., refinery, CEO Paul Eisman says in its earnings conference call.
    • Once permitted, the project, which could handle up to 140K bbl/day, likely would take 6-9 months to build. (Q2 results)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • DBD

    Diebold to pay $48M to settle bribery allegations

    • Diebold (DBD -1.8%) will pay $48M to resolve bribery allegations stemming from a 2010 investigation involving allegedly improper payments to Russian officials.
    • Earlier in the year the company earmarked $18M for an anticipated settlement.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • AMTG

    Apollo Residential bets on higher rates

    • Apollo Residential Mortgage (AMTG -2.3%) partly claws its way back from a 5% opening decline post earnings.
    • The company last night reported a big drop in book value, but the stock price's discount to said book widened to more than 20% in early action.
    • Most interesting about AMTG's Q and earnings call (transcript) is the company turning itself into a play on higher rates in Q3. In Q2, management unloaded a large chunk of its agency MBS (rate sensitive) and added to its holdings of non-agency MBS (credit sensitive, home price sensitive).
    • One CC questioner asked about a stock repurchase authorization plan given the wide discount to book value, and CFO Stuart Rothstein says it's often discussed, but there's no plan for such at the moment. Management continues to see better ways to make money.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • CBLI

    Cleveland Biolabs announces Phase 1 Trials have begun on CBL0137

    • Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +1.8%) says it and Incuron, a joint venture with Bioprocess Capital Ventures, have begun Phase 1 trials evaluating intravenous administration of CBL0137 in patients with metastatic or unresectable advanced solid cancers and lymphomas.
    • The study is open for enrollment and treatment of the first patient has been initiated.
    • The primary objective of the study is to determine the maximally tolerated dose and recommend a Phase 2 dose for CBL0137.
    • Secondary objectives include describing the dose limiting toxicity, adverse event and pharmacokinetic profiling, as well as documenting any objective responses.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • ETFC

    E*Trade tumbles on order-routing investigation

    • E*Trade (ETFC -3.6%) has fallen and can't get up after the company discloses (10-Q) an investigation by FINRA into its customer order-routing practices.
    • The online broker has previously said it was reviewing such practices after a complaint from now-former board member Ken Griffin about whether it was meeting obligations to ensure "best executions" for customers.
    • Along with earnings two weeks ago, E*Trade said it planned to unload its G1 Execution Services unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • TTI

    Tetra Tech misses on Q2 EPS and revenue, but results were priced in

    • Tetra Technologies (TTI +8.8%) posted lower than expected Q2 earnings and revenue, as low activity levels in Mexico and bad weather in Canada hurt results, and guided FY 2013 EPS to $0.70-$0.75 vs. prior guidance of ~$0.80.
    • Investors seem unfazed by the miss: Issues in Mexico and Canada central to TTI's shortfall were well-documented throughout earnings season by similar companies, Sterne Agee says, adding management effectively explained macro issues during the conference call.
    • TTI's "sharp focus on cost reduction and emphasis on key businesses will be positive" for the stock the next year, Sterne Agee says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • CHFS

    Sunshine Heart gains on a solid Q2 report

    • Sunshine Heart (SSH +7%) gets a boost from a better-than-expected Q2 report earlier this morning, as its its loss per share narrowed to $0.35 from a loss of $0.42 the year earlier.
    • Analysts were looking for the loss to widen to $0.43 per share. The company says it's made significant site progress on its C-Pulse COUNTER HF U.S. trial, with three new sites activated and a total of seventeen committed to participate in the trial.
    • Operating expenses increased Y/Y, largely due to increased clinical research and infrastructure expenses related to the C-Pulse U.S. trial and EU post-market study, as well as higher non-cash compensation expenses.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • CAR

    Weak EPS guidance derails Avis

    • Avis Budget (CAR -5.4%) sputters after posting largely in line Q2 results.
    • Likely weighing on the shares is the company's FY13 EPS outlook which, at $2.05-2.35 doesn't look so hot compared to consensus of $2.36. Revenue guidance is $7.8-8B (consensus is $7.9B).
    • The company also announced a new $200M buyback program. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • ATRS

    Antares Pharma moves up despite a mixed Q2; revenues increase

    • Antares Pharma (ATRS +4.5%) gains despite reporting a wider Q2 loss of $0.04 per share, versus the consensus estimate of a $0.03 loss per share.
    • Total revenues increased 29% to $5.8M and product revenues increased 41% to $4.5M compared to Q212.
    • Product sales increases were primarily due to sales to Teva of pre-launch quantities ofÂ  its Vibex auto injector for Teva's generic epinephrine auto injector product.
    • Says Otrexup development program is on track with anticipated PDUFA date of October 14.
    • Expanded its intellectual property portfolio with 43 patents filed and 9 patents issued in the past 18 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • EOG

    EOG Resources' growth and efficiency combo used to be Shell's game

    • EOG Resources' (EOG +1.9%) Q2 results are the antidote to Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B), Liam Denning writes: EOG beat the earnings consensus by 21% while Shell missed its Q2 number by 21%; EOG hiked its 2013 output estimate to 7.5% from 4% as Shell abandoned its ~4% growth target: EOG didn't raise its 2013 capex while Shell maintained its huge budget.
    • EOG isn't relying heavily on borrowing or asset sales to fund growth, Denning notes; consensus is for operating cash flow to fall short of capex by just ~$200M, and net debt of ~$5B is just 0.7x 2013 estimated EBITDA.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • CG

    Carlyle: Harder to find good deals

    • Carlyle Group (CG -1.8%) after-tax distributable EPS of $0.53 is $0.03 short of estimates.
    • $6.9B of new capital raised, bringing Y/Y total to $19.7B; $1.3B invested, bringing Y/Y total to $8.8B.Â $3.9B in realized proceeds, bringing Y/Y total to $19.9B. CEO Rubenstein: "We will slow down fundraising when every single person on Earth is a Carlyle investor."
    • Carry fund portfolio up 3% for Q, up 9% in H1.
    • "We're now truly beginning to sense a shift among investors in terms of a growing appetite for allocations to alternatives."
